body: The following feats are common among orcs, but they can be taken by other races as well.
name: Orc Feats

sections.body: You can defend yourself using the horn or tusk of a creature you're lashed to.
sections.name: Horn Rider

sections.body: You gain a +1 shield bonus to AC when lashed into a horn harness.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: A creature with this feat can take the Mounted Archery feat without possessing 1 rank in the Ride skill or the Mounted Combat feat.
sections.name: Special

sections.body: When the animal you're lashed to charges, you use its momentum in your own attack.
sections.name: Horn Rider's Charge
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Orcs/New Rules/Orc Feats/Horn Riders Charge

sections.body: Whenever you're lashed into a horn harness and you ready an action to make a melee attack against the target of a charge made by the creature you're lashed to, you gain the attack bonus for charging and your attack deals double damage (or triple damage with a lance). This benefit does not stack with the benefit of Spirited Charge.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: Others hate you, and their hatred feeds your own.
sections.name: Mutual Hatred

sections.body: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls against creatures whose hatred racial trait or favored enemy class feature applies to you. For instance, an orc would gain this bonus against all dwarves and against rangers who chose humanoid (orc) as a favored enemy.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: Your ritual scars make you more fearsome, and allies with similar scars grow bolder when they're near you.
sections.name: Scarred Legion

sections.body: You gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks. You also gain a +2 morale bonus on Will saving throws while adjacent to an ally with this feat. When you charge, if you started the charge adjacent to an ally with this feat, you retain the bonus on Will saves until the start of your next turn.
sections.name: Benefit
